general.phrase: It's important to study every day for better results.
The sunset was beautiful over the calm lake.
The teacher was very friendly to all new students.

general.meaning: Giving or ready to give help
general.phrase: My neighbor is always helpful when I need assistance.

general.meaning: Having the ability to make new things
general.phrase: She is very creative with her art projects.

general.meaning: Taking care to avoid danger or mistakes
general.phrase: Be careful when crossing the busy street.
Pizza is a popular food choice among teenagers.
The modern technology makes our lives easier.
This recipe is simple and quick to make.

general.meaning: Existing in nature, not made by humans
general.phrase: I prefer natural foods over processed ones.

general.meaning: Better or more important than usual
general.phrase: Today is a special day for our family.
The weather is perfect for a picnic today.
An honest person always tells the truth.

general.meaning: Willing to give more than necessary
general.phrase: My grandfather was generous with his time and money.
Good teachers are patient with slow learners.
She felt confident about passing the exam.

general.meaning: Wanting to know or learn about things
general.phrase: Children are naturally curious about the world.

general.meaning: Arranged in a neat and logical way
general.phrase: Keep your desk organized for better productivity.
I feel relaxed when I listen to music.
Hard work leads to successful outcomes.

science.meaning: A living creature that can move and eat
science.phrase: The zoo has many different animals from around the world.

science.meaning: A living thing that grows in soil
science.phrase: Water the plant every morning to keep it healthy.

science.meaning: Clear liquid that falls as rain
science.phrase: Drink plenty of water to stay healthy.

science.meaning: Power used to make things work
science.phrase: Solar panels collect energy from the sun.

science.meaning: The physical world including plants and animals
science.phrase: Spending time in nature helps reduce stress.

science.meaning: Conditions outside like rain or sunshine
science.phrase: Check the weather before planning outdoor activities.

science.meaning: The usual weather in a place
science.phrase: The climate here is warm and sunny most of the year.

science.meaning: Very large area of salt water
science.phrase: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean on Earth.

science.meaning: Large area covered with trees
science.phrase: Many wild animals live in the forest.

science.meaning: Very high area of land
science.phrase: We climbed the mountain to see the beautiful view.

science.meaning: Large stream of water flowing to the sea
science.phrase: The river flows through the center of our city.

science.meaning: The planet we live on
science.phrase: Earth is the only planet known to have life.

science.meaning: The area beyond Earth where stars exist
science.phrase: Astronauts travel to space in rockets.

science.meaning: Study of the natural world
science.phrase: Science helps us understand how things work.

science.meaning: Being free from illness
science.phrase: Exercise and good food are important for health.

science.meaning: Treatment used to cure illness
science.phrase: Take your medicine three times a day.

science.meaning: Person who treats sick people
science.phrase: Visit the doctor if you feel unwell.

science.meaning: The natural world around us
science.phrase: We must protect the environment for future generations.

science.meaning: How hot or cold something is
science.phrase: The temperature today is perfect for swimming.

science.meaning: Test done to learn something new
science.phrase: We did a science experiment in class today.

business.meaning: Activity done to earn money
business.phrase: I work at a local restaurant on weekends.

business.meaning: Regular paid employment
business.phrase: She found a good job at the bank.

business.meaning: Coins and notes used to buy things
business.phrase: Save your money for something special.

business.meaning: Activity of buying and selling
business.phrase: My uncle owns a small business in town.

business.meaning: Organization that sells goods or services
business.phrase: The company employs over 100 people.

business.meaning: Person who buys goods or services
business.phrase: Good customer service is very important.

business.meaning: Something made to be sold
business.phrase: This product is very popular with young people.

business.meaning: Work done to help customers
business.phrase: The hotel provides excellent room service.

business.meaning: Amount of money something costs
business.phrase: The price of gas has increased this month.

business.meaning: Act of selling something
business.phrase: The store is having a big sale this weekend.

business.meaning: Money gained from business
business.phrase: The company made a good profit last year.

business.meaning: Place where things are bought and sold
business.phrase: We buy fresh vegetables at the local market.

business.meaning: Place where business work is done
business.phrase: My office is on the third floor of the building.

business.meaning: Person who controls a business or team
business.phrase: The manager held a meeting with all employees.

business.meaning: Person who works for a company
business.phrase: Every employee received a bonus this Christmas.

business.meaning: Gathering of people to discuss business
business.phrase: We have a team meeting every Monday morning.

business.meaning: Legal agreement between people or companies
business.phrase: Read the contract carefully before signing it.

business.meaning: Money put into something to make profit
business.phrase: Real estate can be a good investment.

business.meaning: Plan for spending money
business.phrase: Make a monthly budget to control your expenses.

business.meaning: Achievement of desired goals
business.phrase: Hard work and dedication lead to success.

literature.meaning: Description of events, real or imaginary
literature.phrase: Grandma told us an interesting story about her childhood.

literature.meaning: Set of pages with writing or pictures
literature.phrase: I borrowed a book from the library yesterday.

literature.meaning: Person who writes books or stories
literature.phrase: The author signed copies of her new book.

literature.meaning: Person in a story or play
literature.phrase: Harry Potter is the main character in the series.

literature.meaning: Main good character in a story
literature.phrase: The hero saved the village from danger.

literature.meaning: Exciting and dangerous experience
literature.phrase: The book describes an adventure in the jungle.

literature.meaning: Something that is difficult to understand
literature.phrase: The detective solved the mystery of the missing jewels.

literature.meaning: Stories that are made up, not real
literature.phrase: I enjoy reading fiction more than factual books.

literature.meaning: Writing that expresses feelings in verse
literature.phrase: She writes beautiful poetry about nature.

literature.meaning: Long story book
literature.phrase: This novel took me two weeks to finish reading.

literature.meaning: Play performed in theater
literature.phrase: The school is performing a drama next month.

literature.meaning: Funny play or story
literature.phrase: We watched a comedy that made everyone laugh.

literature.meaning: Piece of writing in verse
literature.phrase: She recited a poem about friendship.

literature.meaning: Activity of looking at and understanding words
literature.phrase: Reading books improves your vocabulary.

literature.meaning: Activity of creating text
literature.phrase: Good writing takes practice and patience.

literature.meaning: System of communication using words
literature.phrase: English is spoken as a second language worldwide.

literature.meaning: Single unit of language
literature.phrase: Learn a new word every day to improve your English.

literature.meaning: Group of words expressing a complete thought
literature.phrase: Write a sentence using your new vocabulary word.

literature.meaning: One side of a sheet in a book
literature.phrase: Turn to page 50 to continue the story.

literature.meaning: Section of a book
literature.phrase: Each chapter in this book tells a different story.

travel.meaning: Go from one place to another
travel.phrase: Many people travel during summer vacation.

travel.meaning: Journey to a place and back
travel.phrase: We're planning a trip to the mountains next weekend.

travel.meaning: Act of traveling from one place to another
travel.phrase: The journey by train was comfortable and scenic.

travel.meaning: Time spent away from work for rest
travel.phrase: We had a wonderful vacation at the beach.
The hotel room had a beautiful view of the ocean.

travel.meaning: Place where airplanes take off and land
travel.phrase: Arrive at the airport two hours before your flight.
Our flight to Paris was delayed by two hours.

travel.meaning: Paper showing you paid for travel
travel.phrase: Keep your ticket safe until the end of your journey.
Pack your suitcase the night before traveling.

travel.meaning: Person who visits places for pleasure
travel.phrase: Many tourists visit this city every summer.
The tour guide explained the history of the castle.
The art museum has paintings from famous artists.
Children love playing in the sand at the beach.
The view from the mountain top was breathtaking.
New York is a busy city that never sleeps.
France is a beautiful country to visit.

travel.meaning: Way of life of a group of people
travel.phrase: Learning about local culture makes travel more interesting.
Try the local food when you visit new places.
Learning basic phrases in the local language is helpful.
Use a map to find your way around the new city.

history.meaning: Study of past events
history.phrase: History helps us understand how the world changed.

history.meaning: Time before now
history.phrase: In the past, people traveled by horse and carriage.

history.meaning: Very old, from long ago
history.phrase: Ancient Egypt had powerful kings called pharaohs.

history.meaning: Fighting between countries or groups
history.phrase: The war ended when both sides agreed to peace.

history.meaning: Time when there is no fighting
history.phrase: After years of conflict, peace finally came to the region.

history.meaning: Male ruler of a country
history.phrase: The king lived in a magnificent castle.

history.meaning: Female ruler of a country
history.phrase: The queen was loved by all her people.

history.meaning: Large strong building where rulers lived
history.phrase: The medieval castle still stands on the hill.

history.meaning: Fight between armies
history.phrase: The famous battle took place near the river.

history.meaning: Finding something new
history.phrase: The discovery of America changed world history.

history.meaning: Person who travels to unknown places
history.phrase: The brave explorer sailed across dangerous seas.

history.meaning: Way of life of a group of people
history.phrase: Ancient Greek culture influenced many other civilizations.

history.meaning: Creative works like paintings and sculptures
history.phrase: Renaissance art is displayed in museums worldwide.

history.meaning: Belief in gods or spiritual ideas
history.phrase: Religion played an important role in ancient societies.

history.meaning: Group of people who rule a country
history.phrase: The government makes laws for all citizens to follow.

history.meaning: Something created for the first time
history.phrase: The invention of the wheel changed transportation forever.

history.meaning: Big change in how things are done
history.phrase: The industrial revolution changed how people worked.

history.meaning: Group of countries ruled by one power
history.phrase: The Roman Empire was one of the largest in history.

history.meaning: Custom passed from older to younger people
history.phrase: Family traditions connect us to our ancestors.

history.meaning: Structure built to remember important events
history.phrase: The monument honors soldiers who died in the war.

geography.meaning: Study of Earth's surface and features
geography.phrase: Geography class taught us about different countries.

geography.meaning: The planet where we live
geography.phrase: Earth is the third planet from the sun.

geography.meaning: Very large area of land
geography.phrase: Asia is the largest continent in the world.

geography.meaning: Very large area of salt water
geography.phrase: The Atlantic Ocean separates Europe and America.

geography.meaning: Area with its own government
geography.phrase: Canada is a country in North America.

geography.meaning: Large town where many people live
geography.phrase: London is the capital city of England.

geography.meaning: Large stream of water
geography.phrase: The Amazon River flows through South America.

geography.meaning: Very high area of land
geography.phrase: Mount Everest is the highest mountain on Earth.

geography.meaning: Very dry area with little water
geography.phrase: The Sahara Desert covers much of North Africa.

geography.meaning: Large area covered with trees
geography.phrase: The rainforest is home to many animal species.

geography.meaning: Piece of land surrounded by water
geography.phrase: Japan is an island nation in the Pacific Ocean.

geography.meaning: Large area of water surrounded by land
geography.phrase: We went fishing at the beautiful mountain lake.

geography.meaning: Usual weather in a place
geography.phrase: The tropical climate is hot and humid year-round.

geography.meaning: Number of people living in a place
geography.phrase: The city's population has grown rapidly in recent years.

geography.meaning: Most important city in a country
geography.phrase: Paris is the capital of France.

geography.meaning: Line separating two countries
geography.phrase: Show your passport when crossing the border.

geography.meaning: Land next to the sea
geography.phrase: The west coast has beautiful beaches and cliffs.

geography.meaning: Low area between hills or mountains
geography.phrase: The green valley was perfect for farming.

geography.meaning: Direction toward the top of maps
geography.phrase: Canada is north of the United States.

geography.meaning: Direction toward the bottom of maps
geography.phrase: We drove south for our winter vacation.

health.meaning: Being free from illness
health.phrase: Good health is more important than wealth.

health.meaning: Person who treats sick people
health.phrase: Visit the doctor if you don't feel well.

health.meaning: Treatment for illness
health.phrase: Take your medicine with water after meals.

health.meaning: Place where sick people are treated
health.phrase: The new hospital has the latest medical equipment.

health.meaning: Physical activity to stay healthy
health.phrase: Regular exercise helps keep your body strong.

health.meaning: Food and drink regularly consumed
health.phrase: A healthy diet includes lots of fruits and vegetables.

health.meaning: Process of getting food needed for health
health.phrase: Good nutrition is essential for growing children.

health.meaning: Being physically healthy and strong
health.phrase: The gym helps people improve their fitness level.

health.meaning: Natural rest when eyes are closed
health.phrase: Adults need about eight hours of sleep each night.

health.meaning: Feeling worried or pressured
health.phrase: Too much stress can harm your physical health.

health.meaning: Substances needed for good health
health.phrase: Fruits contain vitamins that boost your immune system.

health.meaning: Disease or period of being sick
health.phrase: Wash your hands regularly to prevent illness.

health.meaning: Process of getting better after illness
health.phrase: Rest and proper care speed up recovery time.

health.meaning: Stopping something bad from happening
health.phrase: Prevention is better than cure for most diseases.

health.meaning: Medical care for illness or injury
health.phrase: Early treatment can prevent serious complications.

health.meaning: Signs that show someone is sick
health.phrase: Fever and headache are common cold symptoms.

health.meaning: Medical examination to check health
health.phrase: Get a regular checkup to monitor your health.

health.meaning: Practices to maintain health and cleanliness
health.phrase: Good personal hygiene prevents many infections.

health.meaning: Related to the mind and emotions
health.phrase: Mental health is just as important as physical health.

health.meaning: State of being healthy and happy
health.phrase: The wellness program focuses on total health improvement.
